description:
Problem:

I'm unable to create a user or project with nova-manage. I receive the following error:

root@hostlab:~$ nova-manage user
user does not match any options:
	account
	agent
	config
	db
	fixed
	flavor
	floating
	host
	instance_type
	logs
	network
	project
	service
	shell
	sm
	version
	vm
	volume
	vpn

Version: 2012.2 (2012.2-LOCALBRANCH:LOCALREVISION)
title: can't create user or project via nova-manage

comments.content:
Problem:

I'm unable to create a user or project with nova-manage. I receive the following error:

root@hostlab:~$ nova-manage user
user does not match any options:
	account
	agent
	config
	db
	fixed
	flavor
	floating
	host
	instance_type
	logs
	network
	project
	service
	shell
	sm
	version
	vm
	volume
	vpn

Version: 2012.2 (2012.2-LOCALBRANCH:LOCALREVISION)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jeffmarcom

comments.content:
OS Release:
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=12.10
DISTRIB_CODENAME=quantal
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 12.10"

I'm following the documentation guide provided here:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/runnova/nova.manage.html
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jeffmarcom

comments.content:
Those are the essex documentation bits, which should be marked better. 

In Folsom (included in 12.10) you should be using the "keystone" command to do user management.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: The correct documentation for this is at: http://docs.openstack.org/folsom/openstack-compute/admin/content/adding-users-tenants-and-roles-with-python-keystoneclient.html
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~fifieldt

comments.content: I believe we can mark this bug Fix Released since it is accurate for the reporter's environment, 2012.2 . Sound right?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~annegentle
